entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 13 at 2:24PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ICE JAMS IN THE ANCHORAGE BOWL AND MAT-SU VALLEY... The abnormally cold temperatures the past few weeks caused ice formation on area rivers and streams across the Anchorage and Mat- Su valleys. This ice formation is causing ice jams, and has led to localized overflow flooding in the vicinity of the jam. Warming weather this weekend has continued to enhance ice movement on the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 13 at 6:04AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow This Evening Through Monday... Snow is expected to develop this evening and continue through Monday before tapering off Monday night. Snow fall totals are expected to be 2 to 4 inches, with the heaviest amounts north of Fairbanks. This is expected to be a wet and slippery snow. Brief freezing rain is possible this afternoon and evening, and could
entry.cap:areaDesc: Middle Tanana Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 13 at 8:33AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The river level at Astor is forecast to hold steady around 4.0 feet into at least midweek as northerly and northeasterly winds opposing flow of the river return. Residents will see Major Flood impacts through at least Wednesday with a decline to Moderate flood forecast
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 13 at 8:28AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The forecast point at DeLand is forecast to remain relatively steady near 5.2 feet this week as rainfall from Nicole moves through the basin. Residents and interests along the river will continue to see Moderate flooding impacts through the foreseeable future.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 13 at 8:25AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River at Sanford is forecast to slowly rise through Minor Flood Stage and reach Moderate Flood Stage Late Monday or Tuesday, as rainfall from Nicole moves through the basin. Residents and interests along the river should be prepared for Moderate flood
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 13 at 8:22AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River above Lake Harney will slowly increase to 9.3 feet by Monday as observed rainfall from Nicole moves through the basin. Residents and interests along the river will then continue to see Moderate flooding impacts through this week.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 13 at 1:45PM MST until November 14 at 8:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...QUICK BURST OF WINTER WEATHER TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... .A quick-hitting winter storm system will produce a burst of snow and wind with much colder temperatures tonight through Monday morning. Travel impacts are possible over parts of the area with areas of snow, strong winds, blowing snow, and reduced visibility. Wind chill values Monday morning will fall into the single digits.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 13 at 3:27PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ACCUMULATING SNOW AND TRAVEL IMPACTS EXPECTED MONDAY... The first widespread accumulating snow event of the season will begin across western Minnesota late tonight, spread east to the I-35 corridor by mid morning Monday, and then overspread western Wisconsin around midday. Snow totals of 1 to 3 inches are likely before the steadier snow ends Monday evening. Some patchy freezing
entry.cap:areaDesc: Barron; Chippewa; Dunn; Eau Claire; Pepin; Pierce; Polk; Rusk; St. Croix
